alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 17 at 6:17PM EDT until October 22 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southeast Palm Beach and Northeast Broward Counties. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Delray Beach, Lighthouse Point, Highland Beach, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Mission Bay, Whisper Walk, Godfrey Road, Loxahatchee NWR, Sandalfoot Cove, Boca West and Hillsboro Ranches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
